Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
feat\(jyoti\): Phase 1 - Backend simplification for Jyoti standalone app

- Remove unused backend modules \(hunts, reports, connectors, intelligence, analytics, automation, chatbot, iocs, knowledge, guardrails, extraction\)
- Simplify FastAPI main.py: remove unused routers, update app description to "Jyoti - News Feed Aggregator with RBAC"
- Simplify database models:
  * Reduce UserRole enum to ADMIN and USER only
  * Add OAuth fields to User model \(oauth_provider, oauth_subject, oauth_email, oauth_picture\)
  * Add UserWatchListKeyword model for per-user watchlists
  * Add DefaultFeedSource model for admin-managed default feeds
  * Add relationships to User and FeedSource models
- Simplify RBAC system:
  * Reduce permissions to essential Jyoti features only
  * Update role-permission mappings for ADMIN and USER roles
- Update requirements.txt:
  * Add authlib==1.3.0 for OAuth 2.0 support
  * Remove unused dependencies \(celery, apscheduler, slack-sdk, opentelemetry-*, google-generativeai, anthropic, sentence-transformers, numpy, scikit-learn\)
  * Keep openai for article summarization only

This commit establishes the foundation for Jyoti as a lightweight news feed aggregator with RBAC, separate from the Parshu threat intelligence platform.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
feat\(jyoti\): Phase 2 - OAuth integration for Google and Microsoft login

- Create OAuth service \(backend/app/auth/oauth.py\):
  * Configure authlib OAuth client for Google and Microsoft
  * Load client credentials from environment variables
  * Support OpenID Connect discovery

- Add OAuth routes \(backend/app/routers/__init__.py\):
  * GET /{provider}/login - Initiates OAuth flow for google/microsoft
  * GET /{provider}/callback - Handles OAuth callback
  * Auto-creates users on first OAuth login with UserRole.USER
  * Auto-subscribes new users to default feeds
  * Generates JWT tokens and redirects to frontend with tokens

- Update user registration:
  * Auto-subscribe new email/password users to default feeds
  * Set default role to UserRole.USER for Jyoti

- Add OAuth configuration to .env.example:
  * GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID, GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET
  * MICROSOFT_CLIENT_ID, MICROSOFT_CLIENT_SECRET
  * FRONTEND_URL for OAuth redirect

Users can now sign in with Google or Microsoft accounts in addition to email/password authentication.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
